intro: Hedyotis pulvinata, commonly known as the small redweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright red flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Hedyotis pulvinata is an important plant in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local insect populations.
